verses.roman:
na naḥ purojanapadā
na grāmā na gṛhā vayam
vanaukasas tāta nityaṁ
vana-śaila-nivāsinaḥ

synonyms: na—not; naḥ—for us; puraḥ—the cities; jana-padāḥ—developed inhabited area; na—not; grāmāḥ—villages; na—not; gṛhāḥ—living in permanent homes; vayam—we; vana-okasaḥ—dwelling in the forests; tāta—My dear father; nityam—always; vana—in the forests; śaila—and on the hills; nivāsinaḥ—living.
translation: My dear father, our home is not in the cities or towns or villages. Being forest dwellers, we always live in the forest and on the hills.

purport.content: Lord Kṛṣṇa here points out that the residents of Vṛndāvana should recognize their relationship with Govardhana Hill and with the forests of Vṛndāvana, and not worry about a distant demigod like Indra. Having concluded His argument, Lord Kṛṣṇa makes a radical proposal in the following verse.
